content: Saw it in 2011, and it's still rather funny. Most of the comedies of this period don't last long, because of the music, or the way it's done. Not the case here, it's still a perfect comedy after 18 years. Andie McDowel has never been as good as in this movie. Maybe with the exception for her performance in "Four weddings and a funeral". Bill Murray is also playing one of his funniest character. But the best part of this film is the screenplay. It seems that it was the first try by screenwriter Dany Rubin. He wrote the story, and did co-writing of the script with director Harold Ramis. I don't know which part of the success of this film is due to who, but it doesn't matter. There are so much incredibly laughable scenes in the film you can't count them. You won't regret it.

title: A Masterpiece of its Genre
content: A kind of modern take on Charles Dickens' classic "A Christmas Carol" story.One of my all time favorites, I must've seen it as many times as Phil Connor sees Groundhog Day. This film just never gets old. Every facet of it is just so well done. The writing, story beats, and the acting by all and sundry is so natural and real.Why can't comedies, dramedies, romcoms and such, that are cinematically defining and culturally iconic win Oscars and make all-time best movie lists?There isn't a single bad thing or poorly made aspect to it - everything from the soundtrack, editing, cinematography, character constructs, down to the extras. Really, as close to perfection as a film can aim to be.

title: One of the finest films ever made.
content: It's so much more than a comedy. You can watch this movie on so many different levels. You can watch as a pure comedy. You can watch it for the deeper philosophical themes, watch it for the love story, watch it for all the little things that you will pick up the more and more you see it. Watch it for the science and have fun thinking about and discussing time loops.You can watch it 100 times and get something out of it every single time. Truly great and is a film everyone should see before they die.

title: Happy Groundhog Day
content: This film is absolutely a masterpiece. I watch this film each February 2nd on Groundhog Day! I remember the first time I watched this film, I was amazed and impressed at the storyline of this film. This film is really meaningful, the storyline of it is flawless! There are a lot of lovely moments filled with comedy and drama in this film. The actors played terrifically great. Also, the cinematography of the small town of Punxsutawney is really phenomenal! They made an excellent movie that never gets old! I highly suggest that you watch this film every February 2 just like me, because this time of the year is really pleasant and special!

title: A film that can change the way you see the life
content: A minor thing for me is that the film is refinedly funny and that it develops at a continuous speed that you cannot be boring at any moment. An exception of that may be the first ten minutes, because the main character, Phil Connors, achieves to transmit his personal view of life, as a bitter routine. We, as he himself, don't have the minimum interest in the Groundhog day (sorry for those that love groundhogs). Since the moment that Phil Connors is trapped in time, the film is no more senseless. The thing that makes this film so valuable, and not recognized enough, is that it reflects our own lives. The first time that Phil re-lives the Groundhog day, one can think ¿what's happened? ¿which extrasensorial power has made him to be trapped in that date? Oh, well, it's just fantasy. But when you contemplate all the story, you realize that the reason is in Phil himself, the same as the reason why we live our lives as a boring routine is in ourselves. The first things that Phil Connors makes when he realizes that he cannot scape from that endless repetition, are funny, but nonsense. The happiness that we find in those things that we make to break the routine of our lives are funny too for a short time, but the entertainment ends very quickly, because our lives have no sense. The character of Phil Connors searches different ways of finding how to fill his eternal life, but the only one thing that can give sense to his life is LOVE. Not just the relation with that wonderful (until that moment undiscovered) woman, who is working with him, but love to mankind, to any person that needs us. Love means interest in their lives, in their worries. The way he finally breaks the spell can only be understood by those who have penetrate in the meaning of the film.

title: I love this film
content: Much like how Phil Connors day repeats I have watched this movie on repeat countless times and it gets better every single time. I love every scene in this movie, the humor still holds up after multiple viewings and years later. I watch this movie at least once a year on groundhog day. This movie is a classic. It's also really heartwarming and this film is a good stress reliever.

title: simply the best comedy of the last two decades
content: This is a rare combination of an excellent plot, superb acting and clever directing. Equally appeals to all ages and both genders. My wife and teenage son were both enchanted by the twists of the plot and hilarious situations. Bill Murray is so convincing and charming that this one movie made him a comedy superstar. But, of course, the quality of the screenplay and acting will ensure that this movie will remain at the top of the charts for decades to come. The idea of the plot is not original, but nobody even remembers other films exploiting it, while this movie quickly became a classic. It is full of a good humor and romance, and it is fun to watch again and again (I don't know about you, but I can name may be only a couple of other movies that I would like to see multiple times).

title: By faaaaaar Murray's best performance!!
content: OK, now I see what all the hoopla is about. A great comedy indeed! Both funny and touching at the same time! Can't believe it took me this long to see it. Easily Bill Murray's best performance and the film is soooooooooo much better than the overrated GHOSTBUSTERS or CADDYSHACK or SCROOGED. Forget about it!! Great film with a genius story - about the same day repeating over and over. Yet the story doesn't bog down or become repetitive as the days begin repeating. Just the opposite. It becomes more and more engrossing. And how about that Stephen Tobolowsky as NED... NED RYARSON!!!! BING!!! I SURE AS HECKFIRE REMEMBER YOU!!! BING!! Hahaha! Truly a great comedy of 1993 - just a peg below MRS. DOUBTFIRE and HOT SHOTS PART DEUX.

title: This is my all time favorite movie!
content: There's a reason EVERYONE has at least heard about this movie: it's phenomenal. It's perfection. It has so many things that'll make you really think about life. It's funny. It has drama, suspense, thrills, not so much horror but there are a few morbid bits. It's a love story. A survivor story. SciFi, etc, etc.You will fall in love with Groundhog Day so watch it. Watch now! It's a masterpiece.

title: A Narcissistic misanthropes learns compassion in a time warp
content: A misanthropic.meteorologist.learns compassion and relationships as he is forced to endure and confront his ill will towards the people of Puxatany whom he has contempt for as he is imprisoned in by being trapped in a time warp.Classic dark Bill Murray 80's humor.

title: This film will make your Day!
content: Wow! This movie was very very good. It is more funny and clever than you would think. A nice story about a selfish reporter with the Channel 9 and how one day, "Groundhog Day" changes his life forever. The characters and the entire set-up was really good. Bill Murray as Phil Connors was terrific and his personality change was totally convincing. This film entertains, makes you laugh, but above all the fun you have while watching this, it makes you think about the person you want to be and what you are. Actually it teaches you, 'How to be a better Human-being?' The supporting cast including the pretty Andie MacDowell were all very good. Truly a feel good movie. Everyone should enjoy this.All in all a nice film that will make your day...It certainly made mine.9.4/10

title: It's Groundhog Day....Again!
content: There couldn't be a better day to review this annual American favorite than on Groundhog Day itself, obviously. If you're either a Bill Murray fan, comedy fan or just like the film for it's holiday allure, it's fun to watch on Groundhog Day, or any day of the year for that matter. For anyone growing up in the early 1990s, this film was pretty popular from the start, it has a great director and the story is written well enough that it's easily re-watchable. It's also part science fiction, so fans of time travel will love the film as well. Over time, the film has become a holiday staple for the holiday in which it's named, Groundhog Day.The supporting cast includes Andie McDowell, Brian Doyle-Murray (Bill's brother), Chris Elliot (from SNL), and of course Punxsutawney Phil. The film is very comedic, but also has some very sincere moments. Great film for the whole family.

title: every second of your life is on the count.....use it!
content: the real movie that teaches us: how to be optimist,how to behave with your family,your friends,people you love,how to help people just because they are people,and how to see things from the right side VERY,VERY SMART MOVIE!!!!

title: Best time loop movie I've ever watched
content: What would you do if tomorrow is another today? It's the most classic line of a time loop movie and the Groundhog Day is the best.Time loop transformed Phil, a selfish, sarcastic, self-centered loser, into a helpful, happy, hearty lover. Days are turning from being frustrating to desperate, and finally to satisfying.There is a Phil living in every single one of us. We may not have the chance to have this time loop experience. But the Groundhog Day of Phil will be definitely be a reminder for us to how to be a better version of ourselves.It's been a great joy to watch this movie. The plot and the pace are perfect. I will give my very first 10 out of 10 to this lovely movie!!!

title: There's unexpected depth to this silly premise, th...
content: There's unexpected depth to this silly premise, the paving the way for dozens of wildly funny scenes, but nobody is forcing it on you.   Strong and warm performances by all concerned.  A satisfying resolution rarely achieved in film. Vileness is kept to a minimum - a quality harder and harder to find in comedy.  Bill Murray's best movie?

title: I finally figured it out
content:
I watched Groundhog Day many times. Bill Murray, Danny Rubin and Harold Ramis are geniuses. Its funny, sometimes sad, optimistic and deeply profound. It is a classic movie.However I never worked out what was the secret to Phil's success; what did he do to break the cycle and finally move on in the end of the movie. Until now.The idea is that Phil after years and years of hard work, self-improvement and embracing change managed to focus his life and form relationships with others through learning many useful skills and achieving his true potential. He became a selfless, decent, mature, giving human being. Right?Well if that is the case then there are a few things wrong with this premise:
1- Most people in the movie are far away from achieving what Phil achieved. Why are they not stuck like he is?2- Yes Phil helped people around town for no selfish reason - he wanted to be good for the joy of it. But all that he did was superficial. He did not really get deep into people's problems, just scratched the surface. Even if he did go deep, why would that automatically make him a happier person? A lot of doctors, psychiatrists, dentists, charity workers and healers help many people, but many of them are miserable. For example, suicide rates among dentists are higher than average. How do you explain that?3- Rita is a nice, warm, optimistic character, but why does it have to be the beautiful young woman driving Phil to change and be a better man? What about Nancy? She seemed nice and did like him also. I didn't see Rita help anyone in the movie, yes she was optimistic and warm but as far as we could tell she doesn't paly any instrument, or sculpt ice and she did not help old ladies fix their flat tiers or the young couple get married. Why is she so special?Groundhog Day is a very nice movie. Well-written story, very good acting, funny and light-hearted with a good message - it is just not meant to be a serious how-to guide to live one's life.

title: Best Buddhist Movie
content: As a Buddhist, I found this movie such a fascinating take on reincarnation and spiritual evolution through experience. It's also hilarious and has incredible acting. I come back to this film again and again and get something new out of it each time.

title: Great Movie
content: This is one of Bill Murray's best movies i think. Its always on TV and i always watch it. I never get tired of it. It was a good idea for a movie. Bill Murray is one of my favorite actors of all time, he usually delivers a great comedy, and Groundhog Day is one of the best. Great movie, 5\5.

title: A good comedy
content: In the Eighties and Nineties, Bill Murray was one of the great comic actors, and this will be one of the most iconic films of his filmography. I have no doubt of that. The film portrays the journey of a television meteorologist to a small American town to cover the Groundhog Day ceremony (a ceremony that exists in real life) on 2 February. It turns out that this meteorologist is a detestable person with a bad and smug personality. Maybe because of this, he ends up getting stuck in time, reliving countless times the same day until he corrects his own mistakes.The film is not clear on the reasons why the main character gets stuck in time. Simply inexplicable, this phenomenon happened and allows the character to do the stupidest things knowing in advance that he will live everything the next day, so there are no consequences. Generally, I do not like movies where strange phenomena occur without the film explaining to the audience the reason behind it, and I may even consider it as a point against the film, but in this case I am willing to make an exception. In fact, this film is so funny and enjoyable that we do not care about the logical reasons behind the story. The movie works just as well: strange, illogical and funny. That is enough.Murray is the right man for the main character. He is the actor who always seems impassive and serious, even when around him the most stupid things unfold, as if all that were normal. And that makes the performance of this actor even funnier and appropriate for the character. Beside you, a capable cast of support allows you even more room to shine.I will not consider this movie to be brilliant. It was not even thought to be. It's funny, it entertains well the audience and makes laugh without exaggeration. This makes it enjoyable, and a good bet for anyone who simply wants to spend quality time.

title: Bill Murray's best film.  Period.   10/10
content: BM's underrated masterpiece is one of those rare films you will want to watch many times.  Only a handful of films rate that way with me.  All guys nod along that, "yup, that IS what I would try to do if I had the same day to live over and over again..."  It is funny, droll, touching, thought-provoking.  I have probably seen it a dozen times, and I still am able to pick out overlooked gems from this perfectly cast movie.

title: A perfect comedy
content: Comedies are pretty hard to rate on a cinematic scale. You usually judge them much differently than you would a drama film. Most comedies are lacking in some area and therefore don't usually score high amongst voters. I'm pleased to see that this film is on the top 250 list on IMDb, it SOOOO belongs there, because Groundhog Day is just a perfect comedy.Bill Murray is nothing short of sensational as Phil Connors, the man who visits the town of Punxsutawney to cover The Groundhog festival each year. This to him is a boring assignment and he can't wait to get the hell out of Dodge once his job is done. But fate has a another plan for him, as he awakens each following day and it's always Groundhog Day.This is such a well written, expertly performed and hilarious film and it never fails to amuse, no matter if it's the 10th time you're watching it. The premise is very original, and in lesser hands the film's repetitiveness could have gotten tedious, but with this sure-fire script, Harold Ramis's superb direction and, of course, Bill Murray the film is a non stop laugh riot all the way.Recommended for everybody who enjoys a truly funny film.

title: Thoughtful, Spiritual, Comedy & the Ultimate Billy Murray Film
content: 1993's Groundhog Day (A+) is an all-time great comedy that features the best Bill Murray performance of all-time and a surprisingly moving, insightful, and Christian perspective on the meaning of life. The film identifies the sad nature and scope of our human brokenness in Phil and explores how grace and selfless love are his only exit from an existential death spiral. Heavy stuff for a comedy right? Thankfully, the film is able to balance that with the "can you believe this is happening to me?" condescending but hilarious smarm of someone like Bill Murray. It turned out to be a perfect casting choice by director Harold Ramis who would get nearly every major choice in this film perfectly right.Murray plays Phil Connors, a self-centered and mean-spirited weatherman for a television station in Pittsburgh. Along with his producer Rita, Andie MacDowell, and cameraman Larry, Chris Elliot, Phil must head down to the small town of Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania to do a remote broadcast for Groundhog Day. Phil hates the assignment, hates the town, and makes it known to his colleagues. He slogs his way through his Groundhog Day duties, tries to escape Punxsutawney, but is forced to return due a bad blizzard. When he wakes up the next morning, Phil is presented with Groundhog Day...again. Something mystical has happened and Phil is forced to relive the day over and over. How will Phil handle it? Will he ever be able to escape the cycle?

title: it's groundhog day....again
content: without a doubt, one of the funniest films ever made. Usually, you associate funny with dumb, but with groundhog day, you get one of the most intelligent comedies of all time. Mainly set around one day, which weatherman phil conners must relive over and over again, to his utter confusion, the film just throws out brilliant idea after brilliant idea. Bill Murray will probably never be better, his comic timing is superbly spot on. He could say even the most dull line, and make it funny. And without being intimidated, the supporting actors are all as equally good in their own parts. It gets rather sentimental as it moves on, but still doesn't quit with those great one liners. This movie should replace prozac.

title: This is the perfect comedy (for me)
content: It seems that comedy is the hardest thing to agree on.  I know that I have a couple of friends who are annoyed when they watch this movie, and others who could watch this once a week and love every minute (I am in the second group).  I am sure that whatever I say will be nothing more than an echo from someone else's comments.  In any case, here goes...I believe that Murray is about as funny as they come, even though in each movie he seems to play the same character with different degrees of attitude.  I still can't seem to get enough.  This movie is classic Murray.The story is also a metaphor for reincarnation, repeating the same day until you somehow get it right.  I won't hold that against the movie.To me, this is comedy at its best.  It has snappy dialogue that never gets boring, interesting and quirky characters, just the right amount of sappiness and emotion, a smart story, and it never gets too raunchy.  I enjoyed this movie the first time I watched it, and it gets funnier with each viewing.  It's the only comedy that I would rate a perfect 10.

title: One of my favorites.
content: Bill Murray says it all! He is one of my favorite actors of all time and never disappoints me. The repetition and the comedic timing make this movie one I watch every February 2nd. Also, beyond the humor, is the message that to change your life, you have to live each day as if it were your last. Everyone should at least watch it once, because it is a very unique movie.

title: It Will Always Be February 2 in My Mind
content: They say that a symptom of insanity is repeating the same thing, over and over again, expecting different results. Under those standards anyone with a nine to five is certifiable. Yet you add some magical realism and the comedic abilities of Bill Murray and you have yourself arguably one of the best comedies ever put to screen. Certainly one of the best made in the last twenty years.Groundhog Day starts with a particularly onerous Pittsburgh weatherman named Phil Connors (Murray) sent to Punxsutawney Pennsylvania for the annual Punxsutawney Groundhog Day celebration. He lives that day much like any other day; cynical, reluctant and crabby. Thanks to a freak blizzard that shuts down all travel, Phil and his crew (Andie MacDowell and Chris Elliott) grudgingly stay another day in town. Phil wakes up the next morning to find it is once again Groundhog Day with only he having memory of the previous day. Thus Phil is forced to relive February 2 seemingly for all eternity.When first proposed by co-writers Danny Rubin and Harold Ramis (who also directed), studio executives weren't confident that a comedy repeating the same day over and over would keep the audience interested. After all how many times can you see someone say and do the exact same thing hundreds of times without asking for a refund? If you haven't seen Groundhog Day; first off you're a terrible person, and second it's not a movie on repeat.It's a film that dresses an age old hypothetical in new clothes. What would you do if you had all the time in the world? Phil essentially lives forever in a time loop, at first confused, then driven mad, then realizes the potential of his unique situation. He learns everything he can about those around him and improves himself by taking piano lessons, learning to ice sculpt and reading French poetry. How long did it take him to learn all this? Well some say seven years of practice, one hour everyday will make you proficient at anything. Ramis claims that the span of the movie is closer to 10,000 years. Yikes! All that time before internet was readily available? Here to hoping Punxsutawney has a good library.Though focusing on that would take away from the elegant character study and the warm humor of Groundhog Day. Murray transforms from a selfish man into a celebrated pillar of charity and warmth all through the knowledge he has gained of those around him. Does he do this for spiritual transcendence; desire to break the time loop; to get into Andie McDowell's pants; perhaps all, none or something deeper.Over thousands of years of existence humanity is fairly certain of only a handful of things, one of them being we have a unique ability to feel empathy for one another. It's innate and powerful if we only heed to it and one can philosophize that how we structure society, religion and 501(c)3's are largely based on our impulses. Groundhog Day centers on that reality and makes us ponder the value and beauty of human life. When Phil saves a man from choking to death or saves a child from falling off a tree branch he does so out of love for his fellow man.Yet let's not forget, Groundhog Day is ultimately a comedy meant to coax its audience to laugh. Bill Murray's ego-centrism and sighs of futility are the clear comedic highlight of the film and is definitely a career high point for the Saturday Night Live (1975) alum. Yet let's not count out the gregarious supporting work by Brian Doyle-Murray, Stephen Tobolosky and, of course, Andie MacDowell. Also in the mix is Chris Elliott who has the thankless job of playing second fiddle to Murray and somewhat succeeds.The themes of Groundhog Day are benefited by repeated viewing so I highly recommend seeing it again if you haven't viewed it since its last TNT rerun. If you have never seen Groundhog Day watch it as soon as possible and witness a near perfect comedy with a surprising amount of depth. Watch it, and then watch it again, and again, and again. After all everyone can afford to go a little insane every now and then.http://www.theyservepopcorninhell.blogspot.com

title: Murray's greatest performance by far
content: You could watch this over and over and over and over and over and over again and it would never lose it's charm or funniness. Probably the greatest comedy ever.

title: A comedy classic that is well written and sends a good message to viewers about self-importance
content: One of the best comedies I have watched,Groundhog Day succeeds in delivering comedy through one-liners and sarcasm as well as an original storyline.Bill Murray stars as an arrogant TV weatherman from Pittsburgh who decides to travel to Punxsutawney,Pennsylvania with his producer Rita(Andie MacDowell) and cameraman Larry(Chris Elliott) in order to cover the Groundhog Day festivities in which the rest of the season's weather is determined by Punxsutawney Phil who is a groundhog.Because Phil Connors(Bill Murray) is self-centered,things go bad for him as the day repeats itself which means that Phil is stuck in a personal time warp.Because of this,it means that he doesn't have to worry about tomorrow and gives him a chance to right his wrongs.Besides a great deal of comedy,this film also sends a philosophical message to everyone watching this film that it is never too late to make your wrongs turn into rights.Because of all of this,it has become a cult classic,culturally significant and a film that will never be forgotten.It should have been nominated for at least a Best Actor Oscar for Bill Murray and a Best Original Screenplay Oscar.It is as well written as dramas such as The Truman Show and La Vita e Bella.Definitely recommended and it is Bill Murray at his best.Bravo!

title: It's Been Almost 30 Years...
content:
This movie came out two years after I was born, and I just now got around to watching it for the first time. I thoroughly enjoyed it and can say that Groundhog Day has held up well after all these years. The film is funny, sweet, romantic, and even occasionally heartwarming. The dialogue is witty and delivered effortlessly by Bill Murray. It's a lighthearted movie, despite getting occasionally serious and playing
around a bit with dark comedy. But it still
works well as something you can watch with
the family. I appreciated the realistic depiction
of Murray's character in regard to his handling
of the whole "stuck living the same day over
and over again" situation. It always seems
interesting when a story gets us to root for a
very morally messed up character such as this
film's protagonist. I could see this being a
comfort film for many people.

title: Groundhog day once more
content: Bill in his best role ever. I like this movie and saw it several times. Funny and much more, because its a let you thining about your time you have.What can you do better, enjoy and get the best you can ? It's an awesome movie and a must have seen. title: Best Perfect movie, Best Time loop movie I have ever seen
content: Coming to why it's best is not because it has any plot twists or great sci-fi concepts like boring films todays. It addresses a way of life, personality and what is love with a clear plot and makes us think what we can do about "today". Think how we are all rats running today just for tomorrow, just stop there today, see around, understand others around you, have your day completely fulfilled with people and love around you.Moreover, the film challenges viewers to reconsider their own perspectives on time and mortality. Phil's endless repetition of Groundhog Day forces him to confront the finite nature of existence and the significance of each passing moment. In doing so, the film encourages us to cherish the present, savoring every experience and embracing the richness of life's fleeting moments.

title: Words cannot express
content: Need I say more? If you haven't seen it, just know that you're in for a rib-tickling, heart-felt treat. It's extremely funny and if you know Harold Ramis you know that he isn't far from John Hughes. He also plays Igon and also made other great gut-busting fun movies (God rest his soul).This is Bill Murray's greatest and is what A Christmas Story is for Christmas as Groundhog day is for Groundhog day.Fun for the whole family if you're fine with your kids hearing about sarcasm and some sex jokes which I didn't get until much later. This movie is my #1 favorite and it cheers me up during these trying times.

title: a movie you can truely watch over and over
content: Not much more can be said about groundhog day than what already been written in previous reviews, except its a must watch. Bill murray plays probably his best role of his entire career with a memorable role as phil. The days keep repeating, but the laughs and silliness got better and better as the movie moves along. One of those movies that not only entertains, but also makes you look at life in a different perspective to grow on. Hard to say a favorite moment because the entire movie is filled with great scenes. Definite recommend!

title: Not just a good comedy, a *great* film
content: I believe that Rushmore and Groundhog Day may be the two most underrated films of modern times. Both films are moving, funny, poignant and, oddly, feature Bill Murray. It is movies like these two -- that have filled me with such awe and pure joy -- that have moved me to write my own screenplay (something I'm doing for personal satisfaction -- I have little hope it will ever be made).

title: What a premise
content: The only thing that will make this movie seem dated is the costume and hair styling. Wish they could have made this in a Gataca-like set so it can last forever. (Come to think of it, it might work to the Gataca plot too)Bet no one really sees how good this movie can be/work except the crew and producer. Why it doesn't get more attention I have no idea (only thing I could think of is that the original idea came from another film - I'm fairly pessimistic about Hollywood)Murray is fabulous. Some of the scenes are very funny. A tad on the mushy, romantic side but acceptableOnce you accept the premise all you can think about is how do they get out of it ???

title: the most thoroughly romantic movie of the baby boom generation
content: I think when the history of this era is written, the most interesting entry will be for Bill Murray. On SNL he carved out a sort of Andy Kaufman anti-comedy role, the entertainer with no talent who didn't care if you knew; he'd belt out the songs anyway. Which undoubtedly helped cement the rumor that he was the show's dope dealer doing a cameo.Honing the persona year in and out, in Ground Hog Day he's a charmer with no apparent charm, a nihilist with too much success to notice he's depressed. When he gets the chance to reflect, he finds something he really wants, and discovers he has to develop all of his real qualities, hard as they may be to find, to get it. I gave this movie a ten not for its quality alone, but because I think when we ALL reflect we'll recognize it as the signature film of its time.

title: Grumpy Bill Murray has got the time of his life...
content: Starts out as a quirky comedy and slowly transcends into a lovely romantic comedy. Really delightful movie, for young and old. I have seen many reruns of it and it simply makes me feel good every time. Ideal Christmas movie although it aint about Christmas at all, but it has got that lovely "be kind to others and thou will be rewarded" kinda spirit.The good: Bill Murray, Bill Murray, Bill Murray. The man is a comic genius, with his grumpy antics.Any bad? It's a fairytale romantic comedy that could have easily turned out to be cheesy and sentimental, but put Bill Murray as a leading role in it and this movie takes off from the very start. Romantic comedy classic. Ideal date movie as well !

title: A flawless movie
content: I won't say this is the greatest movie of all times since you will most likely disagree with me, but in my world it sure is.Back in good old Sweden this movie was very poorly marketed, but luckily some friends of mine discovered this movie a few years after its premiere and it quickly became our favorite movie. The basic genre of the movie is the "romantic comedy" genre, which is flooded by enjoyable but very average movies that makes time fly by without leaving any major impressions. I believe the genre also is the curse of Groundhog Day, people are supposed to leave their brains shut of when watching these kind of movies and no one is supposed to love romantic comedies, you are meant to like them. In my view Groundhog Day is the most underestimated work of art in the movie history....(or it might be that people simply have different tastes and just don't love the movie as I do, but when it comes to Groundhog Day I don't like that kind of thoughts ;) )The movie is about the art of enjoying your everyday life.... ....or it is a philosophical what-if-movie, about the eventuality of someone having to relive the same day over and over again, reflecting on the moral and psychological consequences... ...or it is a beautiful romantic film where someone manages to change into a better person in order to charm the woman of his dreams... ...or a hilarious comedy that makes you breathless while trying to stop laughing.If you don't like some of the different aspects of the film simply ignore them, you will still enjoy the movie.Groundhog Day is in my view the most obvious 10/10 movie. And I strongly recommend it to anyone, hopingly you will love it too and if you don't you will surely like it.

title: One of the most Meaningful and positive movie ever!
content: Just watched it. It has such depth to it that you actually gonna think and learn from what it tried to express. On top of that, I can't believe it is made in 1993! It really stood the test of time!! Great great movie!!! A++++++

title: Best Comedy
content: Groundhog Day is a hilarious tv show that creates dark humor by killing off the main character over and over. I have watched it countless times and am a sucker for how romantic and cheesy it is. I definitely suggest watching this film if you haven't.

no2. Edge of Tomorrow (action, sci-fi)

title: Wonderful piece of heart-warming comedy
content: Like many others, I still find it staggering that this film was not given even the slightest consideration as Oscar material. It is not as if GROUNDHOG DAY were only a lightweight romantic comedy. It *is* exceptionally funny, the perfect vehicle for Bill Murray's sardonic wit, but like Frank Capra's work (which this film most closely resembles) there is great depth and a message here. Phil Connors' journey from cynicism and vanity to humility and redemption may be a touch whimsical, but it is also touching and finally uplifting. Like IT'S A WONDERFUL LIFE (another film robbed of Oscar recognition), you can watch it again and again. And again. And again...

title: A weatherman is sent to cover a story about a groundhog named Punxsutawney Phil.
content: A weatherman is sent to cover a story about a groundhog named Punxsutawney Phil. He is not happy about covering the story because this is his third year. After doing the story and awaking the following day he discovers that "Groundhog Day" is happening all over again, and again, and again. He at first goes crazy about it and then he starts to realize that he can use this to his advantage. He then realizes that he will spend the rest of his life in the same place, with the same people doing the same thing. Phil Conners is the selfish weatherman for the local station WPBH-TV, Pittsburgh. He has no respect for hi co-workers as well as the viewers. He absolutely hates "Groundhog Day" which is held in Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania. Phil is to cover this event with Rita and Larry who are the new producer and cameraman. After doing the broadcast Phil wants to leave Punxsutawney, Pennsylvania immediately. However, a snowstorm leaves them spending another night. When Phil wakes the next morning he believes he is experiencing déjà vu because he is reliving Groundhog Day all over again. He keeps reliving this day after day after day. He realizes that this may be his fate but also figures out that his actions have no consequences, but the knowledge can help him gain information about what he wants especially when it comes to Rita. Phil is given ample opportunity time after time to get the day "right". Just like in the movie "50 First Dates" where a veterinarian has to keep winning the heart of a girl he fell in love with because she has a short term memory. With every new day he has to start over and make sure he gets it right. In this movie the motif is relevant to this movie because it is where they keep repeating the same day. This is important because it helps the view to understand the theme of the movie. The lighting in this movie was high-key lighting which helped create an effective image for the viewers. All Phil Conners had to do was get the day "right". Until this happened he would keep reliving the same day. This helped him gain knowledge on some stuff he needed but it also helped him realize that he would spend the rest of his life with the same people doing the same thing every day. He was given plenty of days to get it right.

title: The best 90's comedy
content: Groundhog Day is the best comedy of the 90's and I feel was overlooked at the Oscars in a way. The story is that of Phil Connors (Bill Murray) who has arrived in a small town to cover the Groundhog festival with his producer Rita (Andie McDowell) and camera man Larry (Chris Elliot). But when he must stay in the town for the night, he wakes up at in the previous day and it does so, again and again. This movie has the ultimate gag of all time with the concept of living a day for the rest of your life, it is used with great effect and Harold Ramis the director sets up very neat scenarios and does a time warp of the situations he is in but in different days. Bill Murray is in his prime here and Phil Connors is one of his best characters and his portrayl deserved perhaps a nomination, if Kline got one for A Fish Called Wanda then Murray should have recieved one. The sarcasm of Phil is great and the first cover of the festival is some of the most funny sarcasm I have ever seen. It is a shame that Murray doesn't sometimes write his characters dialogue, because he can handle the use  of sarcasm to the best comedic possibilities. There is one scene in the movie which he improvised, Ned comes up to him and instead of being a wise ass he hugs him, Ned is shaken and while hugging, Murray comes up with... "I don't know where you're heading, but, can you call in work sick." Ned obliges politley and runs away, Murray is right on par here in some of his best work. McDowell and Elliot are good too providing solid support but the movie truly belongs to Murray. The two category's this should have been nominated for at the Academy was Best Screenplay and Best Actor, overlooked without a doubt. This film is a very intelligent film, it has such spiritual foundations that it is feel good and also you come away with something new to your life. If you want an intelligent, romantic, fun, hilarious movie, with the best Bill Murray sarcasm, than watch Groundhog Day. When you watch you will want to watch it again, and again, and again...

title: Frank Capra would have been....
content: ... very pleased! Everybody knows the premise. An egoistic, selfish and not quite likable weather man who has been covering the "GroundHog Day" celebration in a small town for the last 4 years, makes his views very clear on what he thinks to be stupid waste of time.He does not spend time with his crew members and after grumbling for some more hours goes to sleep. Next day, Mr. Fantasy kicks in his life, as he finds himself once again reliving "GroungHog Day"... And again... and again...Redundant to say, that in his ordeal of re-living the same day over and over again, he realizes his flaws and becomes a better person in the end... The storyline will have people screaming Frank Capra and Cary Grant(not James Stewart, he would be too "nice" for the main character). However, we get Harold Ramis and Bill Murray instead. And guess what? They make it a gem! Of course, major credit also goes to the script and editing department, which are razor sharp.And one can only visualize(if someone has not already seen the movie, and is a Bill Murray fan) as to what Bill Murray can do with an opportunity like this! The result is a hilarious comedy, along with it's touchy moments(not overdone, though there were plenty of opportunity for those) and the ultimate "redemption". The overall feeling - have to watch it again... and again... and again...

title: I have never laughed as long
content: When I saw the movie at its first release, I found that the various scenes and lines described in this list kept me laughing from one to the next, so that I would be seized with laughter for 10-15 minutes at a stretch. It became physically uncomfortable, and my wife asked me to be quiet several times in the theater. I am delighted to read the comments and recollections of others who reacted to the movie as I did. For a long time, Dr. Strangelove was my favorite movie of all time, but Groundhog Day has now replaced it, although I can't say that I discover much new when I see the movie another time.Regardless of the cinematic or artist merits of the film, I wish that I could laugh that hard and long every few months. It would do my soul good.

title: 27 years on...
content: 27 years on, this is as fresh as the day it came out.

title: A movie to see again and again
content: I don't understand my own fascination for this film, it is a simple comedy/romance yet I watch it over and over again, time paradox at its best. Lovely performances from the townspeople and some imaginative casting, a big hit on a small budget.

title: An Unsung Masterpiece
content: This movie is far more than a good comedy.  It's an analogy to life. Phil's curse is a repetitious day that starts over the same every morning at 6:00 AM - regardless of his actions the "day before".  He alone remembers that it has already occurred.  At first he is clever -- using the situation for personal gain.  He finds out facts about pretty girls on day one, then uses these facts to endear himself to them on day 2.  He robs the armored car truck during the few seconds he knows it is going to be unguarded.  The novelty pales.  Unsatisfied, he becomes more desperate and apathetic. Finally, he realizes that the only way to find true satisfaction is to improve himself, help others, and try to do the world some good instead of trying to figure out what he can get from it.  When he finally lives a day to perfection, the spell breaks and his life falls into place.  It's inspiring, it's hilarious, and it's so intriguing you won't want it to end. You'll want to see this movie every couple of years just so you can remember what life is about.

title: Over & Over Again
content: Harold Ramis directed this inventive comedy that stars Bill Murray as Pittsburgh TV Weatherman Phil Connors, who is a cynical, sarcastic man most resentful about being sent again to cover the annual Groundhog Day festival in Punxatawney Pennsylvania. After spending a joyless day there, he is shocked to learn that it is still the same day(Feb. 2) again. Then again, and again! In fact, no matter what he says or does, he is stuck in a 24 hour time loop that only he knows about. Eventually, Phil starts to change, and becomes determined to win the affection of colleague Rita(played by Andie MacDowell) no matter how long it takes, since Phil has a lot of time on his hands... Wonderful film takes a potentially one-joke premise and constantly finds new things to do with it. Both funny and warm, this really builds up a sense of good will and empathy for Phil, and is also helped by fine supporting performances.

title: Clever plot, marvelously entertaining
content: One of, if not, the best performances of Bill Murray. Clever, unique and a well-written plot. A 90's classic which never gets old.

title: Possibly the best film ever made.
content: Groundhog Day contains the performance of Bill Murray's career, a fantastically inventive script and a wonderful feel-good life-affirming warmth. Not one scene is wasted nor overstays its welcome. What more do you want from a film? Possibly the best film ever made.

title: Perfect.
content: I don't often say a movie is perfect, but this movie is perfect! The premise seems so simple - a man repeats one day over and over - but the execution was incredible. Bill Murray is amazing. Harold Ramis did such a fantastic job of making us care for this jerk, and then follow him emotionally through this journey. One would think that the premise would lend itself to a very repetitive experience, but wow is it fun and interesting to see things develop.Ms. McDowell is great too, a very charming but also very strong female character, who shows integrity and really serves as a kind of feminist moral compass throughout the story, which is wonderful.I recommend this movie 100% to anyone interested in romance, comedy, or time travel / sci-fi.

title: it wouldn't be February without Groundhog Day...
content: If you're planning to kill yourself, because one day is just like the next (and, by implication, that's not a fun thing) - watch this first.Then watch 'It's a Wonderful Life', 'Mary Poppins', 'Schindler's List', 'La Vita e Bella', 'Breakfast at Tiffany's', 'I am Sam', 'Donnie Darko', 'Connie & Carla', 'Complicity' and 'Protest' (the 2005 version by MM productions).If you still want to kill yourself after all of those, you may be beyond hope - or films just don't do it for you. Try books, knitting or morris dancing before passing 'Go' & collecting your big old karmic debt.Hugs, cuddles, kissles, squelchles & tickles - may also work for you.Don't do it until you've tried everything you can think of - and then sat down next to someone on the bus and asked them for everything they can think of.If you're wondering - 3 times.No - not the film - that's about 3 times a year since I first saw it, because... it wouldn't be February without Groundhog Day!

title: After Thoughts
content: One of, (if not my favorite), movie of all time! This is such a charming film that feels so familiar like you have lived in this very town yourself. There is just so much about this movie to love and praise. First off, like I said earlier, the actually town comes alive and the more Bill Murray's character stays there the more familiar it feel to you the audience, and you feel like you know the town and people of it yourself personally. Also the humor is Amazing, the story is great we'll thought out and heart warming. Also I love how much you can dissect the movie and find so many life lessons in it.

title: Good clean fun.
content: It's really clever fun. When Connors wakes up to find that today is, and always will be, yesterday, he is forced into violently confronting the fact that postmodernism conceives of contemporary life as a spectacle before which the individual always sits powerless, and within which questions of the real are always problematized. To the postmodern subject, there is nowhere else, no other time or place, the subject a ghost-viewer in a movie that plays regardless of his volition.At first Connors uses this opportunity to engage in pranks, hedonism and deceit, concocting schemes to amass money and bed a beautiful woman, played by Andie McDowell, but gradually these games start to lose their appeal. After learning that all the material and sexual gratifications in the world are not spiritually sustaining, Connors grows suicidal. He takes his life several times, but still the curse continues.From here on the plot becomes a mixture of the myth of Sisyphus and Dickens' "A Christmas Carol" (Bill Murray is essentially Ebenezer Scrooge), with a little Camus and Nietczhe thrown in. The film's existential avenues are best hinted at by a poem (The Lay of the Last Minstrel) by Sir Walter Scott, an excerpt of which Andie McDowell recites to Connors in a diner: "Despite those titles, power, and pelf, The wretch, concentrated all in self, Living shall forfeit fair renown, And doubly dying, shall go down, To the vile dust from whence he sprung, Unwept, unhonoured, and unsung."And so gradually Connors relinquishes the Self. Of course contemporary neuroscience has now thoroughly undermined the notion of a Sovereign Self, but director Harold Ramis is a Buddhist, and Buddhism has long denied the existence of a metaphysical self. Buddhist's call this "Anatta", or "not self", in which it is taught that all things perceived by the senses are not really "I" or "mine", and in which a line is drawn from the problem of personal identity to moral responsibility.

title: It's deja vu all over again
content: Pleasant comedy about cocky TV weatherman Murray sent unwillingly on Groundhog Day assignment, who has to live the same day over and over and over... Murray has never been better, in a role that requires more than just quick wit. Equal to the task is Andie MacDowell who glows as Murray's producer and possible love interest. For those interested, writer Harold Ramis estimates that Murray was stuck about 30 years on Groundhog Day. Some of Murray's lines are classics that come back to me again and again. Light touch still addresses bigger issues about how we live our lives with nice bottom-line message. Effective musical score and great supporting cast. On my all-time top ten movie list. Very rewatchable, but then again that would make sense....

title: A Classic To Be Re-Lived
content: Bill Murray nails it as a self obsessed reporter who finds himself in a time loop. His deadpan acting style shines, especially when he plays a glum yet carefree victim to this strange situation. He shines with an odd comedic charisma as he seeming shares, but is actually directly copying without them knowing, interests with people he meets, speaking in a very over the top soft voice. He drives in into maximum overdrive, doing the most outrageous things in peace of mind. The movie also has other things to it, such as Bill Murray and Andie MacDowell's chemistry, making it an experience, where if I was stuck in a time loop watching this, it wouldn't be so bad.

title: Ned Ryerson!
content: Until, well, today, Groundhog Day was one of those films that I knew I should have seen because everyone told me it was great but had never gotten around to. Well, now I have and I am glad that I did! Bill Murray's performance is as excellent as you would expect  wry, cynical, charming and, obviously, funny. Andie Macdowell is not horribly annoying in a break from the norm and the concept is attractive and well delivered. My only gripe is that Ned Ryerson needs his own film! What a genius character! I was praying for Murray to knock him out from the first moment he spoke. He's a spectacular comedic creation and really needs his own film, or maybe a spin-off TV show Anyway, good film, go buy.

title: Funny Murray
content: Bill Murray is a TV weatherman at a Pittsburgh station and has to travel to the town made famous by the groundhog named for his wintery predictions. Phil(Bill Murray) is tired of the yearly assignment with the buck toothed animal when he and a news woman, Rita(Andie Macdowell) travel there for the report. They become stuck in town when a blizzard strikes.Phil begins to wake up on the same day every morning to the radio playing, I got you babe. He eventually realizes that he can use this time loop to gather information and use it to his benefit, including the seduction of his coworker, Rita. Murray is funny as hell and Mcdowell holds her own and Groundhog Day works on every level.

title: Best comedy picture in years
content: The basic idea of this film, reliving the same boring holiday over and over again, already had a lot of potential. But the actual presentation of it couldn't possibly be done better. And with that it is a fact that any other movies trying to work out this theme are bound to fail hopelessly, as all the genuinely funny stuff about it already has been done in this one. If you've seen Clean Slate with Dana Carvey, you know what I'm talking about.Bill Murray is hysterical, and it is too bad that he rarely appears in a bullseye hit like this one. The rest of the film: the supporting cast, the music, the styling, everything hits the nail right on the head. It is my favorite comedy and I can watch it as often as I want and still I won't get tired of it!

title: A movie like no other
content: One of the best comedies and one of the best movies ever made, and one which will grow in stature through time. A 'perfect film'. A 'perfect film' being not necessarily the most profound or greatest film, but one with no discernible flaws. Everything works, the writing, acting, how scenes are put together. Princess Bride is another example of a perfect movie.The plot makes this such an "odd" movie. It is its own category, its own genre. I go back to look at individual scenes for themselves. They are varied and wonderful. The absolute best of Bill Murray, and that is saying something. Andie MacDowell at her best too. But the more I see the work of Harold Ramis the more I admire it. He wrote and directed Groundhog Day. He and Dan Aykroyd wrote Ghostbusters. He wrote Animal House. The unique quality of Groundhog Day, the oddness of plot, comes from the creativity of Harold Ramis.

title: Masterpiece
content: This is a perfect motion picture, an original comedy, a brilliant reflection on life in the latter days, a disguised discourse about faith, relativity, change, love, and chance, under the appearance of a comical fantasy... This happens only once in anybody's life. I mean, to be in "Groundhog Day"... including Bill Murray, who immensely benefited from this great film. I could not stop laughing the first time I saw it. It is bright, hilarious and profound. Everything good that it merits has been said and written, although a few things were omitted: dumb members of the Academy of Arts and Sciences simply, fully ignored it 100%. Thankfully it was declared National Film Registry in 2006.

title: A cinematic comedy of gargantuan proportions
content: It is no sooner than the credits of this holy film have gone from the screen that the viewer realizes that he was witnessed the birth of a new Method. Not that of Brando and De Niro, but the aural force emitted from the acting of this spiritual leader, Bill Murray. A majestic performance of astounding subtlety that brings to mind Orson Welles.As Murray cries: "You're hypocrites! All o'ya!", his demented lament - one of a soul trapped in parallel universes of existence -  leaves us to ponder on the meaning of life itself and what we make of it. Harold Ramis' direction is a true tour de force, ripping forward to the uncertain (if any) future of the hero. And when Murray jumps of a chapel (campanario/champagnerie), those of us who have not yet suffered a stroke from intensive spasms of laughter, enter a state of shock, a catharsis both on and off the screen.Arguably one of the greatest comedies of all time, this Kafkaesque interpretation of one man and his weather demands repetitive viewing, until the onset of coma. View and be blessed...

title: Classic
content: This movie is just so timeless I love it. My only issues are sometimes the editing is a bit odd and Phil and Rita sometimes don't seem as believable as I'd hope. Also with the movie being old there's always gonna be some things that feel a little dated.

title: The best
content: This movie is incredible. It is definitely my favorite movie of all time. It's one of those films that could not be pulled off by any other actor.... only Bill Murray could fit this role as Phil Conners, and he fits it perfectly. The incredible extent of his whimsical acting in this film is 80% of what makes it one of the greatest films I have ever seen... the other 20% belonging to the great storyline and supporting characters.This movie can be viewed at any time and still liked. It is a peaceful movie, if you are in relaxed spirits. It is especially great for those nights when you just got home from work or school and the day didn't go as you wanted it to, and you feel though as if life is struggle to no end. This movie is about second chances, and outside of the incredible humor, can be inspiring to get every day of your life right, and to remember the things that are most important in life.Watch it, and see what you think!

title: Classic 90's Feelgood Movie
content: Bill Murray is on top form in this clever life affirming film that has stood the test of time. Andie MacDowell is wonderful too as the object of the weatherman's affection. Some great laugh out loud moments and a warm hearted core make for a film well worth the investment of your time.

title: for all time
content: A film to remember on the day you die. "Have a lived even a day in my little life like the last day of Groundhog Day?" But then Groundhog Day tells us it takes infinite practice to live one such day. Are we then doomed to live out the failed Groundhog Days? Most likely. Perhaps we can shorten the practice period? Unlikely. So the movie is an exercise in envy as the jerk gets a chance to un-jerk his life - no, even just one day of his jerky life.This movie was itself created from 10,000 cycles of filming. It only exited the loop when the director got it perfect. The end-product is what we see now. Awesome.

title: One of my all time favorites
content: This movie has been one of my favorite movies since the day I saw it. First off, I love the premise. Living the same day over and over would start being really fun, then get old, then become hell on earth.Bill Murry is great as the self-loving news channel guy, and Andie is equally as wonderful as the level-headed and sweet girl that anyone could fall for. Everything is in place for a happy romance. But this isn't all about romance. This about learning to appreciate each day for being alive and having everything you have.Groundhog Day is perfection from beginning to end. The end in particular had me in tears with all of it's sweetness.10/10

title: A great feel good movie that's worth watching again and again
content: Bill Murray excels in this sort of role - the miserable and self centered guy who gets sorted out by means of a supernatural intervention, (think Scrooged here). His journey through 'I am a god" enthusiasm, through multiple suicidal tendencies, to finally well rounded nice guy is great to watch.There are really funny supporting performances from Chris Elliott and Stephen Tobolowski, not to mention the lovely Andi McDowell. I particularly like Elliott's face when in a charity bachelor raffle he's bought by a sweet old lady!

title: Surprisingly good film which gets one thinking
content: I have never seen a film that so encapsulates the value of our inner self given that time no longer matters. As Bill Murray lives the same day over and over, we learn that given eternity, the only factor that will change is the person experiencing eternity. We see this through him learning French, the piano, ice sculpting. But I think more intriguing than that is the way Phil learns about the people in the small town. I was incredibly impressed by the scene in which he points out several townspeople and tells their stories. Eternity isn't just about one person, but about finding out about everyone else too.I was also intrigued by the small comparison that was made to God. Obviously Phil was nowhere near divinity, but in one aspect I think the movie approached it - the idea of God outside time. Since Phil could just live the same day over and over, he could really get to know every single person in the town, he could figure out what they needed most at certain times and provide help in the best way he could. In a way, this is an incredible insight into the nature of God, and for Christians it is rather exciting since we believe that every day for God is like Phil's day - lasting for an eternity and in that eternity God can give each of us his own personal treatment and help us out when we most need it. Sorry if that sounds a little overly religious, but it really is what attracted me the most to the film.Finally, the film leaves us with the perfect blueprint of how to live life - as if it were to last for an eternity (and for Christians this is true). This means getting to know people and also changing ourselves for the better over time - not superficially like the weather.

title: Perfect analogy for jyj meetings
content: I love this movie for all the obvious comedic reasons, but what makes it special for me is how it perfectly captured 4 years of my life at my companies regional meetings. We literally discussed word for word the same issues and solutions for 4 straight years every three months. The only thing different was the backgrounds of the power-point presentations and the % differences in growth quarter after quarter. About 3 meetings into this trend, I dubbed our meetings groundhog day. Did they change? Sadly no, they just started saying, "we want to avoid another 'groundhog day' in every presentation. I hope you are able to avoid this tragedy at your company. Great movie, and hilarious business analogy.
